Physics Class Reference

#include <Physics.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Handles the physics for a set of systems.

When a system is added, it is only added up to the point where one of the systems elements collide with another element. (You are not allowed to add elements that will collide with existing elements)
Unless otherwise noted the printDebug argument sets the debug flag (true = on, false = off) for the method passed to in.
The setNotify and setLogfileName sets the notify flag, and logging file name. (see Logger.h)

map< int, unsigned int > Physics::addSystem (  const map< int, vector< vector< double > > > &  system,
double  radius,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG
) 
 

Parameters:
system a system with branches. The map is a system of branches indexed according to their place in the hierarchy. The system is the vector, the innermost vector is the point.
radius the radius to use for collision detection for each element in the system.

double  radius,
bool  printDebug = DO_DEBUG
) 
 

Adds an unbranched system, with one radius for all objects.

Parameters:
system the outer vector is the sytem, the inner represents a point the radius to use for every element in the system (for collision detection)

Adds an unbranched system, with a separate radius for each object.

Parameters:
system the outer vector is the sytem, the inner represents a point
radii a vector of radii, radii.size() must equal system.size()
